title: More efficient logic needed for disk sorting with border values in row value
OB: The current logic for processing disk sorting with border values in row value is not efficient
EB: A more efficient logic is expected to be implemented for processing disk sorting when there are border values in row value. This could involve sorting the data directly in memory and then writing it to the file.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Sort on disk using 40000 rows of data
2. Set the program to process the data less than 40000
3. Save the file as a temporary file
4. Load the file into memory
5. Sort the data
6. Save the sorted data back to the temporary file
